body.p: This installation guide provides information on,

ol.li: the prerequisites for WSO2 IDE Tools

body.p: This document explains how WSO2 WSAS IDE tools should be installed in to eclipse;

WSO2 Web Services Application Server (WSAS) is supplied with pluggable components in the form of Eclipse WTP plugins which enable it to be integrated with the popular IDE Eclipse. This guide is meant to demonstrate the use of WSAS Web Services tools in combinations with the Eclipse Web Tools Platform Project using WTP 3.0 or higher drivers. The guide shows how to create a simple Web service and client based Web service operations using the linked Dynamic Web Projects of WTP and how to make use of wsas tools.

tr.td: 1.5 or higher (For instructions on setting up the JRE in different operating systems, visithttp://java.sun.com)

p.p: Start Eclipse and Go to Help -> Software Updates . Select Available Software
If you downloaded the plugin select the downloaded plugin from the file list by clicking Archive button.
If you wish to online install the tools type the update site url http://wso2.org/tools/eclipse
Click OK to add the site. Uncheck the "Group itesm by category" check box (if you are using galileo) and select the features shown below in the image. Click Install...

body.p: In order for this feature to be fully used it needs the WSAS server running inside eclipse. The WSAS Server integration plugins (eg: WSO2 Eclipse WSAS v3.1) can also be downloaded from http://wso2.org/projects/tools.

Using this WSAS integration plugin you can bring up a WSAS server instance inside eclipse to deploy/debug web services through this server and provide the necessary libraries and tools for stub/skelton generation. We recommend downloading the latest WSAS server related integration feature.
